name: Contemporary Italian Cinema I
description: (Offered in English) This course is a study of Italian cinema from the 1980s to the present. Dramas, documentaries, comedies, and short films, from various directors (Bernardo Bertolucci, Nanni Moretti, Giuseppe Tornatore, and others), will be analyzed. Prevalent themes include odes to Italian cinema, family matters, love, celebrity culture. [24L, 24T]
prerequisites: Open to all students. If enrolled in an Italian Minor, Major or Specialist program, ITA100Y5.
exclusions: ITA245H5, ITA246Y5, ITA247Y5, , ITA240Y1, ITA340H1, ITA341H1, ITA342H1, ITA345H1, ITA347H1, ITA441H1
